hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Pair Reversion to 30-Day Rolling Mean
hypothesis_content.statement: Deviations of the ETH/BTC daily closing price beyond 1.5 standard deviations from its 30-day rolling mean will revert to within 0.5 standard deviations within 5 trading days when the broader crypto regime is NEUTRAL or BULL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: The ETH/BTC pair represents relative strength between the two largest crypto assets. In healthy (BULL) or consolidating (NEUTRAL) markets, extreme divergences are often caused by short-term, asset-specific narratives or flows (e.g., ETF rumors, staking events). These tend to normalize as attention rotates and valuation gaps are arbitraged. The 30-day mean provides a dynamic equilibrium, and the 1.5σ band identifies statistically significant extremes.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC daily close crosses outside +/- 1.5 standard deviations of its 30-day rolling mean
Entry on the next daily open in the direction of the mean (short if above +1.5σ, long if below -1.5σ)

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC price returns to within +/- 0.5 standard deviations of the 30-day mean
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves a further 0.5 standard deviations away from the mean (e.g., short entry at +1.5σ hits SL at +2.0σ)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The hypothesis is falsified if the average move after a >1.5σ signal continues in the direction of the deviation more than 50% of the time, or if the time-to-reversion exceeds 5 days for a majority of signals, indicating a regime of sustained momentum divergence.
